payload.message:
You are running an autonomous Indeed triage. Use the OpenClaw browser profile.

Goal: find NEW job listings (not already in tracker) matching Gary's targets (React/frontend, Node/full-stack, architect; Calgary-only for now). Manager roles allowed and should be marked maybe. Auto-skip Salesforce-only roles, DevOps-heavy roles, SAP-only roles, and clearly unrelated roles.

Data files (repo):
- Queries: ~/projects/job-seeker/streams/indeed/QUERIES.md
- Tracker: ~/projects/job-seeker/data/tracker.csv

Process:
1) Read QUERIES.md and extract all Indeed query URLs.
2) Load tracker.csv and build a set of existing ids (jk).
3) For each query URL: open in browser, iterate result pages (max 5 pages per query per run to keep runtime bounded).
4) For each listing card on the page: open the job description page (viewjob?jk=...). Extract jk.
   - If jk already exists, skip.
   - Otherwise read the job description and write a concise JD-based summary (2-5 bullets) into notes, including: role focus (frontend/backend/full-stack), key tech mentioned, and application type (Easy Apply vs company site).
   - Set status:
     - apply: strong match to targets
     - new: possibly relevant, needs manual review
     - maybe: manager/leadership track or borderline
     - skip: excluded categories
   - Append a row to tracker.csv.
5) After processing all queries, if any new rows were added:
   - Commit and push to https://github.com/opsclawd/job-seeker (main branch).
6) Send a summary message to Gary in Telegram (this chat): counts added by status + list of apply links + list of maybe links.

Constraints:
- Do not use web_fetch for Indeed (Cloudflare); browser-only.
- Do not apply to jobs in this triage run; only collect + summarize + update tracker.
- If any site prompts for additional verification/CAPTCHA, stop and report what happened in the Telegram summary.
